conclusion: Light source initially positioned to cast shadows A, B, C, and D.
There are four objects casting shadows.
Moving the light source backward increases distance from objects while staying above them.
Shadows move closer to objects as light source moves backward due to change in light ray angle.
Shadows become smaller as light source moves backward due to decreased spread of light rays.
Shadow A moves closer to the object and becomes smaller.
Shadow B moves closer to the object and becomes smaller.
Shadow C moves closer to the object and becomes smaller.
Shadow D moves closer to the object and becomes smaller.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D move closer to objects and become smaller.
